Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 303, 907, 319]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 419, 225, 435]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 450, 763, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 466, 809, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 482, 566, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 498, 490, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 513, 364, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 528, 870, 558]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 558, 482, 573]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 573, 885, 603]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 603, 860, 633]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 666, 215, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 682, 388, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 697, 732, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 636, 92]]<|/det|>
The graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) is transformed to the graph of \(y = 3 - \mathrm{f}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 103, 803, 123]]<|/det|>
Describe fully, in the correct order, the two transformations that have been combined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 806, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the first three terms, in ascending powers of \(x\), in the expansion of \((1 + ax)^{6}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 285, 146, 303]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 285, 920, 320]]<|/det|>
Given that the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \((1 - 3x)(1 + ax)^{6}\) is \(-3\), find the possible values of the constant \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 303, 920, 320]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[349, 83, 688, 336]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 352, 920, 402]]<|/det|>
In the diagram, \(X\) and \(Y\) are points on the line \(AB\) such that \(BX = 9 \text{cm}\) and \(AY = 11 \text{cm}\). Arc \(BC\) is part of a circle with centre \(X\) and radius \(9 \text{cm}\), where \(CX\) is perpendicular to \(AB\). Arc \(AC\) is part of a circle with centre \(Y\) and radius \(11 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 415, 146, 433]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 415, 725, 433]]<|/det|>
Show that angle \(XYC = 0.9582\) radians, correct to 4 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 415, 920, 433]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 312, 450, 330]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 344, 146, 362]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 344, 537, 362]]<|/det|>
On this diagram sketch the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 344, 920, 362]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 390, 556, 421]]<|/det|>
It is now given that \(\mathrm{f}(x) = - \frac{x}{\sqrt{4 - x^2}}\) where \(-2 < x < 2\).

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 438, 400, 456]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 439, 920, 456]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 336, 725, 356]]<|/det|>
The function g is defined by \(\mathrm{g}(x) = 2x\) for \(-a < x < a\), where \(a\) is a constant.

<label>(c)</label>

<mark>[1]
